snippet: Fertility clinics are using new chromosomal tests to help identify embryos that will give a woman the best shot at a successful pregnancy.
abstract: Some fertility clinics are using chromosomal tests to help identify embryos that give a woman the best possible chance of successful pregnancy; techniques can increase low efficiency of in vitro fertilization, and can reduce chance of having twins or triplets, which face higher health risks; critics say the expensive technology is being promoted too heavily without supporting data.
lead_paragraph: Fertility clinics are using new chromosomal tests to help identify embryos that will give a woman the best shot at a successful pregnancy.

headline.main: Fertility Clinics Scan for the Strongest Embryo
headline.print_headline: A Fitness Test, on the Smallest Scale
